Package dev.nhuels.volunteerservice.repository

Interface ShiftRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<Shift,Long>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Shift,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<Shift,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<Shift,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<Shift,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<Shift>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<Shift,Long>
public interface ShiftRepository extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Shift,Long>
Repository interface for Shift entities. This interface extends JpaRepository, providing methods for CRUD operations. It also declares custom methods for finding shifts by event ID, user ID, and whether the user ID is null.

  • Method Details

    • findShiftsByEventId

      Set<Shift> findShiftsByEventId(Long eventId)
      Finds shifts associated with a specific event ID.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event.
      Returns:
      A set of shifts associated with the event.

    • findShiftsByUserId

      @Query("SELECT s FROM Shift s JOIN s.registeredVolunteers v WHERE v.userId = :userId") Set<Shift> findShiftsByUserId(Long userId)
      Finds shifts associated with a specific user ID.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user.
      Returns:
      A set of shifts associated with the user.

    • findAvailableShifts

      @Query("SELECT s FROM Shift s WHERE size(s.registeredVolunteers) < s.maxHelper") Set<Shift> findAvailableShifts()
      Finds shifts that are not associated with any user.
      Returns:
      A set of shifts that are not already full.

    • findAvailableShiftsByEvent

      @Query("SELECT s FROM Shift s WHERE size(s.registeredVolunteers) < s.maxHelper AND s.eventId = :eventId") Set<Shift> findAvailableShiftsByEvent(Long eventId)
      Finds shifts associated with a specific event ID and are not associated with any user.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event.
      Returns:
      A set of shifts associated with the event and are not already full.
